remarks.format: ## Remarks 类旨在保存异类对象的集合。The class is designed to hold heterogeneous collections of objects. 但是，它不始终提供最佳性能。However, it does not always offer the best performance. 相反，我们的建议如下：Instead, we recommend the following: - 对于异类对象的集合，使用`List

threadsafe.span: 公共静态 (在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员都是线程安全。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 同时，可以支持多个读取器，只要不修改该集合。

span.span: An can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保的线程安全性，所有操作必须通过返回的包装器来都完成方法。

span.span: To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不会复制的内容。 does not copy the contents of . 相反，而只会创建周围包装; 因此，更改为也会影响。Instead, it only creates an wrapper around ; therefore, changes to the also affect the . 类提供了泛型，和方法。The class provides generic , and methods. 此包装可以是一种方法上使用的那些方法; 但是，执行通过包装这些泛型操作可能比直接在上应用的操作的效率较低。This wrapper can be a means to use those methods on ; however, performing these generic operations through the wrapper might be less efficient than operations applied directly on the . 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## 版本兼容性Version Compatibility .NET framework 版本 1.0 和 1.1 中，调用上的方法重载包装返回的枚举数上限，而不是计数处理第二个参数。In the .NET Framework version 1.0 and 1.1, calling the method overload on the wrapper returned an enumerator that treated the second argument as an upper bound rather than as a count. 在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)]第二个参数正确视为计数。In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] the second argument is correctly treated as a count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 接受`null`作为有效的值，并允许重复的元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value and allows duplicate elements. 中的元素的顺序在过程中保留。The order of the elements in the is preserved in the . 如果新(当前plus 集合的大小) 将大于、 容量的增加通过自动重新分配以容纳新元素，在内部数组和在添加新的元素之前，现有元素被复制到新数组。If the new (the current plus the size of the collection) will be greater than , the capacity of the is increased by automatically reallocating the internal array to accommodate the new elements, and the existing elements are copied to the new array before the new elements are added. 如果可以容纳新元素，而无需增加，此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是要添加的元素数。If the can accommodate the new elements without increasing the , this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements to be added. 如果增加以容纳新元素所需的容量，此方法会成为 O (`n` + `m`) 操作，其中`n`是要添加的元素的数目和`m`是。If the capacity needs to be increased to accommodate the new elements, this method becomes an O(`n` + `m`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements to be added and `m` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将元素添加到。The following code example shows how to add elements to the . remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`参数和的每个元素必须实现接口，用于比较。The `value` parameter and each element of the must implement the interface, which is used for comparisons. 元素必须已在增加根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序实现; 否则，结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by the implementation; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 比较`null`允许与任何类型和使用时不会生成异常。Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using . 在排序时，`null`被视为小于任何其他对象。When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object. 如果多个元素具有相同的值，该方法返回仅包含一个匹配项，并且可能会返回任何一个匹配项，不一定是第一个。If the contains more than one element with the same value, the method returns only one of the occurrences, and it might return any one of the occurrences, not necessarily the first one. 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 你可以应用于此负的整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 插入到的值时，此索引应使用的插入点，若要维护的排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order. 此方法为 O (日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用查找中的特定对象。The following code example shows how to use to locate a specific object in the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 比较器自定义如何比较元素。The comparer customizes how the elements are compared. 例如，你可以使用实例作为要执行不区分大小写的字符串搜索的比较器。For example, you can use a instance as the comparer to perform case-insensitive string searches. 如果`comparer`提供的元素与使用指定的指定值进行比较实现。If `comparer` is provided, the elements of the are compared to the specified value using the specified implementation. 元素必须已在增加根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序`comparer`; 否则为结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by `comparer`; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 如果`comparer`是`null`，完成比较使用通过自身的元素或指定的值提供的实现。If `comparer` is `null`, the comparison is done using the implementation provided by the element itself or by the specified value. 元素必须已在增加根据定义的排序顺序的值进行排序实现; 否则，结果可能不正确。The elements of the must already be sorted in increasing value according to the sort order defined by the implementation; otherwise, the result might be incorrect. 比较`null`允许与任何类型和使用时不会生成异常。Comparing `null` with any type is allowed and does not generate an exception when using . 在排序时，`null`被视为小于任何其他对象。When sorting, `null` is considered to be less than any other object. 如果多个元素具有相同的值，该方法返回仅包含一个匹配项，并且可能会返回任何一个匹配项，不一定是第一个。If the contains more than one element with the same value, the method returns only one of the occurrences, and it might return any one of the occurrences, not necessarily the first one. 如果不包含指定的值，该方法返回负整数。If the does not contain the specified value, the method returns a negative integer. 你可以应用于此负的整数，以获取大于搜索值的第一个元素的索引的按位求补运算 （~）。You can apply the bitwise complement operation (~) to this negative integer to get the index of the first element that is larger than the search value. 插入到的值时，此索引应使用的插入点，若要维护的排序顺序。When inserting the value into the , this index should be used as the insertion point to maintain the sort order. 此方法为 O (日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的示例创建彩色动画。The following example creates an of colored animals. 提供执行二进制搜索的字符串比较。The provided performs the string comparison for the binary search. 显示一个迭代搜索和二进制搜索的结果。The results of both an iterative search and a binary search are displayed. remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的示例获取的枚举数，和中的元素范围的枚举数。The following example gets the enumerator for an , and the enumerator for a range of elements in the . therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## 版本兼容性Version Compatibility 中的.NET Framework 版本 1.0 和 1.1 中，枚举数包装返回方法被视为第二个参数，上限为而不是做一个计数。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, the enumerator for an wrapper returned by the method treated the second argument as an upper bound rather than as a count. 在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)]第二个参数正确视为计数。In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] the second argument is correctly treated as a count. ## Examples 下面的示例获取的枚举数，和中的元素范围的枚举数。The following example gets the enumerator for an , and the enumerator for a range of elements in the . remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合是只是一个集合的包装器防止添加和移除元素;因此，如果对基础集合，包括添加或移除元素，进行更改的固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何创建的固定大小包装。The following code example shows how to create a fixed-size wrapper around an . remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要确保的线程安全性，所有操作必须通过返回的包装器来都完成方法。To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回 ，因此，您可能需要将返回的值强制转换为原始类型以便对其进行操作。The returns an , so you may need to cast the returned value to the original type in order to manipulate it. 请务必注意， 不是个强类型集合。It is important to note that is not a strongly-typed collection. 有关强类型替代项，请参见 。For a strongly-typed alternative, see . 接受`null`作为有效的值，并允许重复的元素。 accepts `null` as a valid value and allows duplicate elements. 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[index]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`. C# 语言使用关键字进行定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值的运算 o （1）;设置属性也是 o （1） 运算。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation; setting the property is also an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建并添加多个项。The following code example creates an and adds several items. 此示例演示具有访问元素属性 （索引器在 C# 中），并通过将新值赋给分配更改元素的指定索引的属性。The example demonstrates accessing elements with the property (the indexer in C#), and changing an element by assigning a new value to the property for a specified index. 该示例还演示属性不能用于访问或添加外部列表的当前大小的元素。The example also shows that the property cannot be used to access or add elements outside the current size of the list. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法使用，它使用快速排序算法。This method uses , which uses the QuickSort algorithm. 快速排序算法是比较 （也称为不稳定排序），这意味着"小于或等于"的排序比较操作将确定这两个元素应首先出现在最后一个已排序的列表。The QuickSort algorithm is a comparison sort (also called an unstable sort), which means that a "less than or equal to" comparison operation determines which of two elements should occur first in the final sorted list. 但是，如果两个元素相等，则可能不会保留其原始顺序。However, if two elements are equal, their original order might not be preserved. 与此相反，一个稳定排序保留相等的元素的顺序。In contrast, a stable sort preserves the order of elements that are equal. 若要执行一个稳定排序，则必须实现一个自定义接口若要使用此方法的其他重载。To perform a stable sort, you must implement a custom interface to use with the other overloads of this method. 一般情况下，此方法为 O (`n`日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是; 在最坏情况下它复杂度为 O (`n`^2) 操作。On average, this method is an O(`n` log `n`) operation, where `n` is ; in the worst case it is an O(`n`^2) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何进行排序中的值。The following code example shows how to sort the values in an . [!code-cpp[Classic ArrayList.Sort Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.Sort Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ArrayList.Sort Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.Sort Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ArrayList.Sort Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.Sort Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 方法通过实现 接口的自定义比较器对对象的列表进行排序。Use the method to sort a list of objects with a custom comparer that implements the interface. 如果为 `null` 传递 `comparer`，则此方法将使用每个元素的 实现。If you pass `null` for `comparer`, this method uses the implementation of each element. 在此情况下，您必须确保列表中包含的对象实现 接口，否则将发生异常。In this case, you must make sure that the objects contained in the list implement the interface or an exception will occur. 此外，使用 实现意味着此列表将执行比较排序（也称为“不稳定排序”）；也就是说，如果两个元素相等，则可能不会保留其顺序。In addition, using the implementation means the list performs a comparison sort (also called an unstable sort); that is, if two elements are equal, their order might not be preserved. 与此相反，一个稳定排序保留相等的元素的顺序。In contrast, a stable sort preserves the order of elements that are equal. 若要执行一个稳定排序，则必须实现一个自定义接口。To perform a stable sort, you must implement a custom interface. 一般情况下，此方法为 O (`n`日志`n`) 操作，其中`n`是; 在最坏情况下它复杂度为 O (`n`^2) 操作。On average, this method is an O(`n` log `n`) operation, where `n` is ; in the worst case it is an O(`n`^2) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何进行排序中的值使用默认比较器和将反转排序顺序的自定义比较器。The following code example shows how to sort the values in an using the default comparer and a custom comparer that reverses the sort order. remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要确保的线程安全性，必须通过此包装器完成所有操作。To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through this wrapper. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source2.vb#2)] 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. 下面的代码示例演示如何同步，确定如果同步以及如何使用同步。The following code example shows how to synchronize an , determine if an is synchronized and use a synchronized . [!code-cpp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic ArrayList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要创建的同步的版本，使用方法。To create a synchronized version of the , use the method. 但是，派生的类可以提供自己的同步的版本使用属性。However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the using the property. 同步代码必须在执行操作的，而不是直接在。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the of the , not directly on the . 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体地说，这样可保持正确的同步，与可能同时对修改其他线程对象。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the object. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the during the entire enumeration.
